TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1489
TEI.2.document_title: WIlliam Carroll to Stephen F. Austin, 11-05-1826

barker_notes.barker_summary: William Carroll to Austin, November 5, 1826. Introducing B. F. Foster.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1489

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*William Carroll to Austin, November 5, 1826. Introducing B. F. Foster.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Nashville*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="11-05-1826">November 5. 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Sir:*/p*
*p*Altho not personally known to you, I make no apology for introducing to your acquaintance*person_mentioned* Colo Benjamin F Foster*/person_mentioned* of this place, who goes to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*as the *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*for the *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Leftwich*/person_mentioned* Grant.*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Colo Foster*/person_mentioned* is a young *person_mentioned*Lawyer */person_mentioned*of fine education and good talents— of extensive and highly respectable connections and has always sustained the character of a moral, intelligent and honorable young *person_mentioned*gentleman*/person_mentioned*-—As such it gives me pleasure to recommend him to your kind civilities and friendly offices.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Wm. Carroll*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Colo. Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*Colo Foster*/person_mentioned**/p*.
*/div1*
